update.description:
This pull requests adds the gazebo_ros_force plugin to enable to apply forces (perturbations) to the robot's pelvis. 

This adds the plugin to get compiled as well as adds to the atlas.gazebo urdf file to load the plugin to enable forces to the pelvis.
update.title: Added gazebo_ros_force plugin

content.raw: Okay, I believe I have made the requested changes and addressed all your concerns. Thanks for the link to the guidelines as well.
content.html: Okay, I believe I have made the requested changes and addressed all your concerns. Thanks for the link to the guidelines as well.

content.raw:
The `gazebo_plugins` package in ROS does not conform to the Gazebo style [guidelines](http://gazebosim.org/user_guide/modifying__style.html).

We have become extremely strict on code quality.
content.html:
The gazebo_plugins package in ROS does not conform to the Gazebo style guidelines.

We have become extremely strict on code quality.

content.raw: @nkoenig Are you implying that this pull request will not be accepted unless your comments are addressed? The source files all came straight from the gazebo_plugins package from ros fuerte.
content.html: @nkoenig Are you implying that this pull request will not be accepted unless your comments are addressed? The source files all came straight from the gazebo_plugins package from ros fuerte.

content.raw: Add `gazebo` to all the gazebo includes: `#include "gazebo/physics.hh`
content.html: Add gazebo to all the gazebo includes: #include "gazebo/physics.hh

content.raw: Remove this example usage, or update it to use the current versioin of SDF
content.html: Remove this example usage, or update it to use the current versioin of SDF

content.raw: Change controller to plugin
content.html: Change controller to plugin

content.raw:
Add documentation all of these lines. 
Also group functions and member variables together. The class definition should have the following layout:


```
#!c++

class
{
    public functions
    protected functions
    private functions
   
    public members
    protected members
    private members
};
```
content.html:
Add documentation all of these lines. Also group functions and member variables together. The class definition should have the following layout:

class
{
    public functions
    protected functions
    private functions

    public members
    protected members
    private members
};

content.raw: Condense these two to lines: `/// \brief ROS wrench topic name inputs`
content.html: Condense these two to lines: /// \brief ROS wrench topic name inputs

content.raw: Add documentation.
content.html: Add documentation.

content.raw: Add documentation.
content.html: Add documentation.

content.raw: Add documentation.
content.html: Add documentation.

content.raw:
Move ampersand to be next to `_msg`.
Add documentation about the parameter: `/// \param[in] _msg <something about _msg>`
content.html: Move ampersand to be next to _msg. Add documentation about the parameter: /// \param[in] _msg <something about _msg>

content.raw: `// Documentation inherited.
content.html: `// Documentation inherited.

content.raw:
You can remove the documentation for this function, and replace it with:

    // Documentation inherited.
content.html:
You can remove the documentation for this function, and replace it with:

// Documentation inherited.

content.raw: This line can be removed
content.html: This line can be removed

content.raw: Remove SVN line.
content.html: Remove SVN line.

content.raw: Camel case all names.
content.html: Camel case all names.

content.raw: Remove trailing underscores from all class members.
content.html: Remove trailing underscores from all class members.

content.raw: Okay, done. Do you not want this as part of default?
content.html: Okay, done. Do you not want this as part of default?
